hook: Jake moved into a new apartment with a massive old mirror in the hallway. Every time he walked past, something felt off—his reflection smiled when he didn’t, or wore clothes he didn’t own. He laughed it off, blaming stress. One night, the mirror cracked slightly. Behind it, Jake found a hollow wall with wires and cameras. It wasn’t a mirror at all—it was a one-way window. Someone had been watching him from the other side, mimicking him, studying him. His reflection hadn’t been a reflection. It was someone who wanted to become him.
